turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new games to play. I really enjoy RPGs, but I'm open to suggestions. Anything good out there?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Based on your preference for RPGs, I can recommend a few titles. Are you looking for something on PC, console, or mobile? Also, are there any specific RPG subgenres you enjoy, such as action RPGs, turn-based RPGs, or open-world RPGs?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, good questions. I mainly play on PC. I really like open-world RPGs, but I'm getting a bit tired of the same old fantasy settings. Something different would be great.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, for open-world RPGs on PC that deviate from traditional fantasy, I'd recommend checking out 'Cyberpunk 2077'. While it had a rocky launch, it's been patched significantly. Also, 'The Outer Worlds' offers a sci-fi experience with a lot of player choice.  If those aren't appealing, can you tell me a bit more about what you *don't* enjoy in a game? That will help me narrow down the suggestions.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I tried Cyberpunk, and it was buggy for me even after the patches. I also really don't like games that are too grindy or that have a lot of fetch quests. Basically, I want something with a good story and fun combat, not a lot of busywork.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand. Given that, have you considered 'Divinity: Original Sin 2'? It's a turn-based RPG, which is different from open-world, but it has an incredible story, deep character customization, and excellent combat. The grind is relatively minimal. Another option, though not strictly RPG, is 'Elden Ring'. It's action-oriented, but the exploration and lore are superb.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Elden Ring... I've heard of that one. It looks brutally difficult, though. I'm not very good at those types of games. Is it *really* as hard as everyone says, or is it just overblown?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a challenging question! 'Elden Ring' is known for its difficulty, yes. However, a lot of that difficulty can be mitigated by exploring the open world, leveling up, and summoning other players or NPCs for assistance. The game rewards patience and strategic thinking more than twitch reflexes. It's not just about being good at button mashing. Consider watching some gameplay videos to get a feel for it before you decide.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks! That's helpful. I'll definitely check out those games and do some research. I appreciate the suggestions and the clarification on Elden Ring. Good work!
